#STOZ #10: Sobti's piece de resistance, Zindaginama establishes her as one of the greatest writers of the our times.
#STOZ #9: Literature arises naturally from life, Zindaginama proves this otherwise embattled proposition.
#STOZ #8: It is unfortunate that Zindaginama hasn't found a Satyajit Ray to present it to the world the way Pather Panchali was presented.
#STOZ #7: The continuities and disjunctions of the advent of modernity are beautifully presented in Zindaginama.
#STOZ #6: In Z the network of relationships that ties people together makes the reader yearn for, and recognize the networks we live within.
#STOZ #5: When Zindaginama ends it leaves a tremendous ache for a world that was irretrievably fractured by Partition.
#STOZ #4: Zindaginama is the ultimate Partition novel although Partition is not mentioned even once.
#STOZ #3: The music of village life, the piety, the respect between religious groups are all captured with an amazing lightness of touch.
#STOZ #2: A panoramic view of rural Punjab at the beginning of the 20th century, Z takes literary ambition to an all-time high.
